natural problem: Define the operation $\spadesuit$ as $a\,\spadesuit\,b = |a- b|$ . What is the value of $2\, \spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\,7)$?

a_0.formal problem:
definition spade_op :: "real ⇒ real ⇒ real" 
where "spade_op a b = abs(a - b)"

theorem
assumes h0 : "spade_op 4 7 = 3"
shows  "spade_op 2 (spade_op 4 7) = 1"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Define the operation $\spadesuit$ as $a\,\spadesuit\,b = |a- b|$ . What is the value of $2\, \spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\,7)$? The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 Work from the inside out: \begin{align} 2\,\spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\, 7)&=2\,\spadesuit\,(|4-7|) \\ &=2\,\spadesuit\,|-3|\\ &=2\,\spadesuit\, 3 \\ &= |2-3| \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

definition spade_op :: "real ⇒ real ⇒ real" 
where "spade_op a b = abs(a - b)"

theorem
assumes h0 : "spade_op 4 7 = 3"
shows  "spade_op 2 (spade_op 4 7) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: A new operation, called "spade", is defined as the absolute difference between two numbers. Given that the spade operation between 4 and 7 equals 3, find the result of the spade operation between 2 and the result of the spade operation between 4 and 7. The final answer is 1.

a_1.formal problem:
definition spadesuit :: "real ⇒ real ⇒ real"
where "spadesuit a b = abs(a - b)"

theorem
shows  "spadesuit 2 (spadesuit 4 7) = 1"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Define the operation $\spadesuit$ as $a\,\spadesuit\,b = |a- b|$ . What is the value of $2\, \spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\,7)$? The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 Work from the inside out: \begin{align} 2\,\spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\, 7)&=2\,\spadesuit\,(|4-7|) \\ &=2\,\spadesuit\,|-3|\\ &=2\,\spadesuit\, 3 \\ &= |2-3| \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

definition spadesuit :: "real ⇒ real ⇒ real"
where "spadesuit a b = abs(a - b)"

theorem
shows  "spadesuit 2 (spadesuit 4 7) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Given the function $♠(a, b) = |a - b|$, find the value of $♠(2, ♠(4, 7))$. The final answer is $1$.

a_2.formal problem:
definition spade :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
where "spade a b = abs (a - b)"

theorem
assumes h0 : "spade (spade 4 7) 2 = 1"
shows  "spade (spade 4 7) 2 = 1"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Define the operation $\spadesuit$ as $a\,\spadesuit\,b = |a- b|$ . What is the value of $2\, \spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\,7)$? The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 Work from the inside out: \begin{align} 2\,\spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\, 7)&=2\,\spadesuit\,(|4-7|) \\ &=2\,\spadesuit\,|-3|\\ &=2\,\spadesuit\, 3 \\ &= |2-3| \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

definition spade :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
where "spade a b = abs (a - b)"

theorem
assumes h0 : "spade (spade 4 7) 2 = 1"
shows  "spade (spade 4 7) 2 = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a = 2"
and h1 : "b = 4"
and h2 : "c = 7"
and h3 : "\<forall> a b. a \<spadesuit> b = abs (a - b)"
shows  "a \<spadesuit> (b \<spadesuit> c) = 1"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Define the operation $\spadesuit$ as $a\,\spadesuit\,b = |a- b|$ . What is the value of $2\, \spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\,7)$? The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 Work from the inside out: \begin{align} 2\,\spadesuit\,(4\,\spadesuit\, 7)&=2\,\spadesuit\,(|4-7|) \\ &=2\,\spadesuit\,|-3|\\ &=2\,\spadesuit\, 3 \\ &= |2-3| \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a = 2"
and h1 : "b = 4"
and h2 : "c = 7"
and h3 : "\<forall> a b. a \<spadesuit> b = abs (a - b)"
shows  "a \<spadesuit> (b \<spadesuit> c) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
